refnamediv.refpurpose: Reads an image from a file or an URL

listitem.para: A string containing the complete image file's path or an URL

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function reads an image from a file or an URL. It returns a matrix made of the image data in gray levels or an hypermatrix made of the RGB data of the image depending on the type of the input image.

The mlist jimage gathers : the image data in the 'image' field, the type of encoding in the 'encoding' field, the title of the image in the 'title' field and the extension of the file in the 'format' field. The 'gray' type indicates a 2D matrix of gray levels data. The 'rgb' type indicates an hypermatrix with one layer for each color (Red, green and blue). The 'rgba' type indicates an hypermatrix with 4 layers.The last one is for the alpha channel.
MIME-types png, bmp, gif and jpg are handled by jimread() besides images encoded in CMYK.
